New Records: England became the sport's first dual white-ball champions, holding both the 50- and 20-over titles.
England joined the West Indies as the only two-time winners of the T20 World Cup since the tournament's inception in 2007.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes scored an unbeaten 52 to steer England to a five-wicket victory.
Sam Curran and Ben Stokes starred in England's win.
England held Pakistan to 137-8 in front of 80,462 fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
England slumped to 49-3 in the sixth over before Stokes and Moeen Ali guided them to 138-5 with six balls to spare.
Post-Match Reflections: The victory added to the 50-over title England won in 2019, building on the legacy of former captain Eoin Morgan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Melbourne Cricket Ground in Australia.
The tournament spanned 45 games over nearly a month.
